etymology.description: 舌(舌) (shé, "tongue") + 甘(甘) (gān, "sweet") = tongue tasting sweetness -> sweet
etymology.interpretation: 甜(甜) (tián, "sweet") combines 舌(舌) (shé, "tongue") and 甘(甘) (gān, "sweet") to represent the concept of tasting sweetness, which conveys the idea of something sweet to the taste.

examples.chinese: 这蛋糕真甜(這蛋糕真甜)。
这个苹果很甜(這個蘋果很甜)，咬上一口满是果香(咬上一口滿是果香)。
examples.pinyin: zhège píngguǒ hěn tián, yǎo shàng yì kǒu mǎn shì guǒxiāng.
examples.english: This apple is very sweet, and one bite is full of fruity aroma.

examples.chinese: 蜂蜜的滋味很甜(蜂蜜的滋味很甜)。
examples.english: The taste of honey is very sweet.
